questions.question: He was called Christy .................................................... his grandfather who had died in the civil war.
questions.description: Call after = be named after somebody

questions.question: There is not much ............................................ air-conditioners during the winter season.
This spike in property prices forced us to ........................................... buying a new apartment.
Do you ............................................. people who live together before they get married?
She likes to .................................................... old clothes for some strange reason
questions.description: To hold onto something is to keep it longer than necessary

questions.question: ............................................ your hands. I am going to inspect your finger nails
questions.description: To hold out is to extend in front of you

questions.question: The strikers .................................................. until the management agreed to give them what they wanted.
questions.description: To hold out is to resist / protest.

questions.question: ................................................. the rope. I am going to pull you up.
questions.description: To hold onto something is to grip it tightly

questions.question: She is very ill. She can't .............................................. even water.
questions.description: To keep food down is to keep it in the stomach without vomiting.

questions.question: The police ............................................ the protesters .............................................. by blocking the road.
questions.description: To keep somebody back is to keep them at a safe distance.
